SEARCH
Package data

Class GenericDAO<T>

java.lang.Object
data.GenericDAO<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the entity that this DAO will manage
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientDAO, OrderDAO, ProductDAO
public abstract class GenericDAO<T> extends Object
Abstract generic Data Access Object (DAO) class that provides the common functionality for all DAO classes. This class handles basic CRUD operations with database for any type of entity.

  • Method Details

    • getTableName

      protected String getTableName()
      Returns the table name based on the entity type.
      Returns:
      the simple name of the class, which is used as the table name.

    • getPrimaryKeyColumnName

      protected String getPrimaryKeyColumnName()
      Gets the primary key column name of the table associated with the entity. This method should be overridden if the primary key column is not named 'id'.
      Returns:
      the primary key column name

    • findAll

      public List<T> findAll()
      Retrieves all entities of type T from the database. This method executes a SELECT query and returns a list of all entities found in the corresponding table.
      Returns:
      a list of all entities of type T found in the database, or an empty list if no entities are found.

    • insert

      public T insert(T t)
      Inserts a new entity into the database. This method dynamically constructs an SQL INSERT statement to add a new record to the database using the entity's fields.
      Parameters:
      t - the entity to insert into the database
      Returns:
      the entity with its ID updated to reflect the generated key from the database, or null if the insertion fails
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an issue executing the insert command

    • findById

      public T findById(int id)
      Finds a single entity by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the entity to find
      Returns:
      the found entity, or null if no entity is found

    • update

      public T update(T t)
      Updates an entity in the database. This method constructs an SQL update query dynamically based on the entity's fields.
      Parameters:
      t - the entity to update
      Returns:
      the updated entity, or null if no update was performed

    • delete

      public boolean delete(int id) throws SQLException
      Deletes an entity from the database by its primary key ID. This method executes an SQL DELETE statement to remove a record from the database.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the entity to delete
      Returns:
      true if the entity was successfully deleted, false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error during the deletion process

    • getFieldColumnMapping

      protected abstract Map<String,String> getFieldColumnMapping()
      Provides a mapping from entity fields to database column names. This method must be implemented by subclasses to map entity fields to the corresponding database columns.
      Returns:
      a Map where keys are field names and values are column names
